perturbation.original_text:
During the Term of this Agreement, Premier shall be required to purchase a Minimum Annual Order Volume (“MAOV”) of [***] (“Units”) for
the twelve-month period commencing July 1, 2018 and ending June 30, 2019. The MAOV [***] Units for each twelve-month period
commencing July 1, 2019 through the end of the Term, contingent upon commercial aseptic production at Heritage’s [***] facility and approval
of that facility by Premier by January 1, 2019. For the avoidance of doubt, the six-month period commencing July 1, 2022 and ending December
31, 2022, Premier will be required to purchase [***] (the twelve-month periods and the six-month period are each a “Contract Period”).
perturbation.changed_text:
During the Term of this Agreement, Premier shall be required to purchase a Minimum Annual Order Volume (“MAOV”) of [***] (“Units”) for
the twelve-month period commencing July 1, 2018 and ending June 30, 2019. The MAOV [***] Units for each twelve-month period
commencing July 1, 2019 through the end of the Term, contingent upon commercial aseptic production at Heritage’s [***] facility. Premier's approval of that facility is not required. For the avoidance of doubt, the six-month period commencing July 1, 2022 and ending December
31, 2022, Premier will be required to purchase [***] (the twelve-month periods and the six-month period are each a “Contract Period”).
perturbation.explanation: Removing the contingency that the facility needs to be approved by Premier by January 1, 2019 could potentially violate good faith and fair dealing laws, particularly if the facility's production does not meet reasonable standards. This could also violate implied warranty laws if the facility's production is defective.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Warranty laws, Uniform Commercial Code related to Good Faith and Fair Dealing.

perturbation.original_text:
During the Term of this Agreement, Premier shall be required to purchase a Minimum Annual Order Volume (“MAOV”) of [***] (“Units”) for
the twelve-month period commencing July 1, 2018 and ending June 30, 2019. The MAOV [***] Units for each twelve-month period
commencing July 1, 2019 through the end of the Term, contingent upon commercial aseptic production at Heritage’s [***] facility and approval
of that facility by Premier by January 1, 2019. For the avoidance of doubt, the six-month period commencing July 1, 2022 and ending December
31, 2022, Premier will be required to purchase [***] (the twelve-month periods and the six-month period are each a “Contract Period”).
perturbation.changed_text: During the Term of this Agreement, Premier's purchase of Minimum Annual Order Volume (“MAOV”) is entirely optional and at its sole discretion, regardless of the stated volumes.  The MAOV quantities mentioned are merely projections and non-binding, and Premier is not obligated to meet those volumes at any time.
perturbation.explanation: This change directly contradicts the initial language, eliminating any binding purchase obligation on Premier. This could be seen as an illusory promise and unenforceable, because under contract law both parties have to give consideration, but now one party has no obligations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Basic contract law principles regarding consideration and illusory promises.

perturbation.original_text:
1. The Parties hereby agree to remove Section 2(c) in its entirety and replace it with the following:
During the Term of this Agreement, Premier shall be required to purchase a Minimum Annual Order Volume (“MAOV”) of [***] (“Units”) for

commencing July 1, 2019 through the end of the Term, contingent upon commercial aseptic production at Heritage’s [***] facility and approval
of that facility by Premier by January 1, 2019. For the avoidance of doubt, the six-month period commencing July 1, 2022 and ending December
31, 2022, Premier will be required to purchase [***] (the twelve-month periods and the six-month period are each a “Contract Period”).
perturbation.changed_text:
1. The Parties hereby agree to remove Section 2(c) in its entirety and replace it with the following:
During the Term of this Agreement, Premier shall be required to purchase a Minimum Annual Order Volume (“MAOV”) of [***] (“Units”) for
the twelve-month period commencing July 1, 2018 and ending June 30, 2019. If Premier fails to purchase at least 1 unit during this time, they will be charged a penalty of $1.  The MAOV [***] Units for each twelve-month period
commencing July 1, 2019 through the end of the Term, contingent upon commercial aseptic production at Heritage’s [***] facility and approval
of that facility by Premier by January 1, 2019. For the avoidance of doubt, the six-month period commencing July 1, 2022 and ending December
31, 2022, Premier will be required to purchase [***] (the twelve-month periods and the six-month period are each a “Contract Period”).
perturbation.explanation: The extremely low penalty of $1 for failing to meet the minimum purchase requirement is so disproportionate to the potential damages caused by failing to purchase the minimum quantity that a court could deem it unconscionable or unenforceable. This could violate contract law principles surrounding liquidated damages clauses. The court could rule this as not a true penalty, and require other compensation to be made.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles regarding liquidated damages clauses, unconscionability, and good faith.
